msItem.note: Fols. 1r-2v blank.

msItem.author: Alexander de Villa Dei
msItem.title: Carmen de arte Algorismi seu Arithmetica
msItem.incipit: Hec algorismus ars presens dicitur, in qua
msItem.explicit: Post duc in articulum in se ducente secunda

msItem.rubric: Hic est terminus pasche qui nunquam in bisexto preterit, nec sine bisexto
msItem.incipit: 1. post nonas aprilis prima dominica fiet pascha
msItem.note: Addition. Fol. 8r blank.

msItem.author: Petrus de Dacia
msItem.title: Kalendarium
msItem.incipit: In hoc primacionum ciclo .4. linee descendentes
msItem.note: Followed by:
msItem.rubric: (fols. 15v) Tabula principalis Gerlandi, continens in se multa utilia ecclesie
(fols. 16r) Tabula. 2a. Gerlandi: et est contra-tabula prima
(fols. 16v) Tabula Petri Daci de loco lune inveniendo in quolibet die anni a media nocte sui incepto
msItem.note: Listed in the table of contents as "Kalendarium magistri Petri cum tabulis Gerlandi".
Saints in the calendar include Genevieve (3 Jan. and tr. 26 Nov.), William of Bourges (10 Jan.), translation of Mary Magdalen (19 March), Louis (Aug. 25), Denis (9 Oct.); Apollonia added, 10 Feb.

msItem.author: Johannis de Sacro Bosco
msItem.title: Algorismus
msItem.rubric: Incipit Algorismus
msItem.incipit: Omnia que a prima rerum origine processerunt ratione numerorum formata sunt
msItem.explicit: Et hec de radivum extraccione dicta sufficiant
msItem.note: Listed in the table of contents as "Algorismus Comunis".

msItem.author: Johannis de Sacro Bosco
msItem.title: Tractatus de sphaera
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus de Spera. ([fols. 25.]) Magistri Johannis de Sacro Bosco
msItem.incipit: Tractatum de spera .4. capitulis distinguimus
msItem.explicit: propter quod Dyonisius Arriopugita in eadem passione legitur dixisse. aut Deus nature patitur: aut lota mundana machina cito dissolvetur. Explicit.
msItem.note: With diagrams; the quotations from the Latin poets, and other verses, are written in larger script.

msItem.title: Treatise on fractions (eTK 0320F)
msItem.rubric: Incipit Algorismus de minucijs philosophicis
msItem.incipit: Cum multos de numeris tractatus vidisses
msItem.explicit: nequid solum necessarium desit operi tam brevissimo.
msItem.note: Two small tables are subjoined (taken “ex alba tegni”), intitled “Tabula multiplicationis integrorum et minutiarum,” and “Tabula divisionis eorundem.”

msItem.author: Johannes de Sacro Bosco
msItem.title: Compotus
msItem.rubric: Incipit Compotus Johannis de Sacro Bosco
msItem.incipit: Compotus est scientia considerans tempora ex lune et solis motibus et eorum ad invicem coequacionibus distincta
msItem.explicit: Dicitur etiam evum idem quod eternitas: unde Boethius in de consolacione philosophica. “O qui perpetua mundum ratione gubernas, Terrarum celique sator, qui tempus ab evo Ire jubes, stabilisque manens das cuncta moveri; Tu stabilire velis opus hoc per temporis evum! M. xp’i bis C. quaterdeno quater anno, De Sacro Bosco discrevit tempora ramus, Gratia cui nomen dederat divina Johannes. Annuat hoc nobis hujus sic carpere fructum, Ecclesie xi quod nos bine fructificemus. Amen.
msItem.note: The verses are written as in art. 4.

msItem.author: Robertus Anglicus
msItem.title: Tractatus quadrantis veteris
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Quadrantis Veteris secundum magistrum Johannem in Monte Pess’
msItem.incipit: Geometrie due sunt partes. theorica et practica
msItem.explicit: et predictum dabit capacitatem vasis quadrangularis. Explicit.
msItem.note: At f. 72 is a complete figure of the Quadrant, well drawn; the radius of which is 5⅞ inches.

msItem.rubric: Tabula Solis in anno bisextili ad inveniendum locum ejus in orbe declivi fixo
msItem.note: Another table "ad annum 3m. post bissextum"
msItem.rubric: Tabula declinacionis Solis que est distancia ejus ab equinocciali secundum Albategni

msItem.author: Māshāʼallāh
msItem.title: De compositione astrolabii
msItem.rubric: Prohemium in Astrolabium Messehalach
msItem.incipit: Scito quod astrolabium est nomen Grecum, cujus interpretacio est accepcio stellarum
msItem.explicit: et nota illa erit polus zodiaci ut patet in hac figura
msItem.note: There is a complete figure of this instrument at f. 81; and, beside many other diagrams and figures, a complete drawing of a Volvelle, which is here called “Rethe. volvellum. vakagora. [vel] alhantabuz” [?] at (fol. 87v)

msItem.author: Māshāʼallāh
msItem.title: Practica astrolabii
msItem.rubric: Incipit Practica Astrolabii, sive rememoracio parcium astrolabij
msItem.incipit: Nomina instrumentorum sunt hec. Primum est armilla suspensoria
msItem.explicit: talis est comparacio stature iue ad planiciem. Explicit.

msItem.title: Theorica Planetarum
msItem.rubric: Incipit Theorica Planetarum, et primo de theorica solis et circuli ejus
msItem.incipit: Circulus ecentricus vel egresse cuspidis

msItem.author: Thebit ben Chorat
msItem.title: De motu octauae spherae
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Thebit de motu octave spere
msItem.incipit: Ymaginabor speram equatoris diei et 3 circulos in ea signatos
msItem.explicit: super minorem numerum cum quo intrasti in linea numeri

msItem.author: Thebit ben Chorat
msItem.title: De hiis quae indigent expositione antequam legitur Almagestum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Thebit ben Chorat de hijs que indigent expositione antequam legatur Almagesti
msItem.incipit: Equator diei est circulus major
msItem.finalRubric: Expletus est liber Thebith filij Chore, de hijs que indigent expositione antequam legatur almagesti
msItem.note: Listed in the table of contents as “Thebit de expositione vocabulorum Almagesti.”

msItem.author: Thebit ben Chorat
msItem.title: De recta imaginatione spherae
msItem.rubric: Liber Thebit de ymaginatione spere, et circulorum ejus diversis
msItem.incipit: Nos juxta ymaginacionem rectam inchoantes astrologiam
msItem.explicit: Hec sunt que inlroducendis primo ymaginanda occwrunt

msItem.author: Thebit ben Chorat
msItem.title: De quantitate stellarum
msItem.rubric: Incipit liber Thebit de quantitatibus stellarum et planetarum, et primo terre
msItem.incipit: Ptholomeus et alij sapientes posuerunt corpus terre commanem mensuram qua meciebantur stellarum corpora
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit liber Thebith. de quantitatibus stellarum

msItem.author: Profatius Judaeus
msItem.title: Quadrans nouus
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Quadrantis Novi, compositus a Magistro Profacio Hebreo, anno dominice incarnacionis. 1288. et correctus ab eodem, anno Domini .1301. Laus Deo.
msItem.incipit: Cum stellarum scientia sine instrumentis congruis minime compleatur
msItem.note: This tract consists of 18 chapters, and the two last pages (f. 131va—2r) contain figures of a circular instrument, and of the Quadrant described therein.

msItem.author: Accursius of Parma (?)
msItem.title: Sphaera solida siue astrolabium sphericum
msItem.rubric: In nomine Domini nostri ihū xp’i incipit tractatus de Spera Solida, sive de Astrolabio Sperico, compositus anno Doi 1303
msItem.incipit: Tocius astrologice speculacionis radix et fundamentum ejus
msItem.rubric: Explicit compositio instrumenti. Incipit secunda pars libri. Capitulum primum de utilitatibus generalibus hujus instrumenti.
msItem.incipit: Et post quam auxiliante Deo scripsimus
msItem.explicit: Et quoniam de mensuris tractare non est presentis intencionis hunc tractatum sub laude Dei finiemus

msItem.author: John Peckham
msItem.title: Perspectiua
msItem.rubric: Incipit Perspectiva Fratris Johannis de Pecham. Cantuariensis quondam Archiepiscopi
msItem.incipit: Inter philosophice consideracionis studia lux jocundius afficit meditantes
msItem.explicit: que autem falso dicunt de gride, multum possunt refelli per hoc quod in hujusmodi lapidibus contemplantur
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Perspectiva Fratris Johannis Pichani quondam Kantuariensis Archiepiscopi

msItem.author: Franco de Polonia
msItem.title: Modus construendi torquetum
msItem.note: (eTK 0383E)
msItem.rubric: De tabula Turketi que dicitur orizon, deserviente equinoctiali
msItem.incipit: De omnibus parcium instrument quod turket. dicitur
msItem.explicit: sagax lector facile per se inveniet ex predictis. Deo gratias. Explicit.
msItem.note: This tract is illustrated with several figures.

msItem.title: De compositione chilindri
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Chilindri quod horologium dicitur viatorum. Capitulum primum de formacione corporis chilindri quantum ad hoc quod spectat ad vertitorem.
msItem.incipit: ([fol. 179]) Investigantibus chilindri dispositionem
msItem.note: On the last page is drawn the form of a cylindrical sun-dial.

msItem.author: Pierre de Maricourt
msItem.title: Epistola de magnete
msItem.rubric: Epistola Petri Peregrini de Maricourt, ad Sygetum de Foucancort militem, de Magnete
msItem.incipit: Iste tractatus de magnete .2. partes continet. Quarum prima .10. capitulis completur, et tribus secunda
Amicorum intime, quandam magnetis occultam naturam, a te interpellates, rudi narratione tibi reserabo cum uscunque
msItem.note: The second instrument is the Mariners’ Compass, of which a curious diagram is given, 3½ inches in diameter.

msItem.author: Alexander de Villa Dei
msItem.title: Massa compoti
msItem.rubric: Incipit Massa Compoti a Magistro Alexandro compositi
msItem.incipit: Licet modo in fine temporum plures haberi constat codices qui de arte calculatoria videantur posse sufficere
msItem.rubric: Sequitur a quo mense habeat inicium aureus numerus et claves terminorum, secundo quomodo formantur
msItem.incipit: Aureus in Jano numerus clavesque novantur
msItem.rubric: Sequitur quomodo inveniatur litera in tabula Bede si sit perdita ad formandam tabulam Dionisij
msItem.explicit: Qua mediante potest quod queris semper haberi

msItem.rubric: Hec est tabula ad inveniendum pascha sine compoto. Et cum fueris in fine, revertere in capite ejusdem
msItem.incipit: Si quis scire voluerit rotam precedentem
msItem.note: Two Easter tables; they appear to belong to art. 22, as the latter page (vol. 199r) is superscribed with the running title “Massa.”

msItem.rubric: In hoc volumine continentur isti tractatus astronomie
msItem.note: List of contents, not in their current order.

layoutDesc.layout: Mostly 2 cols. of 35-37 lines, ruled space approx. 160 105
Item 1, 1 col., 32 lines; item 22, 1 col, 30 lines.

additions.p: A few marginal notes in more than one hand; including, fol. 12v, notes written in the first person concerning a journey from London to Calais, and thence to Neuport and Bruges, in July 1361; fol. 15r, notes of a convention at Bruges, between the Dukes of Burgundy and Anjou, and the Duke of Lancaster and the Earl of Cambridge, about peace, 29 Dec. 1375.

history.provenance: Localized by Pächt and Alexander as "English (?)" (with date 14th century, second quarter); penwork and calendar might suggest France (perhaps Paris?).

Merton, Surrey, Augustinian priory of St Mary the Virgin: "Liber ecclesie beate Marie de Merton. juxta London. in dioc. Wynton. traditus domino Johanni Gysborne canonico ejusdem loci et scolari Oxon. per magistrum Johannem Kyngestone Priorem de Merton. predicta in sacra theologia professorem, anno Domini Millesimo CCCCmºquinquagesimo sexto." (fol. 202v). (MLGB3: evidence from an ex-libris inscription or note of gift to an institution).
Bequeathed by him to the Ashmolean Museum in 1692.
history.acquisition: Transferred to the Bodleian Library in 1860.

recordHist.source:
Description adapted (Sept. 2023) by Matthew Holford from the following sources, with limited additional physical description:
W. H. Black, A descriptive, analytical, and critical catalogue of the manuscripts bequeathed unto the University of Oxford by Elias Ashmole Esq...., Quarto Catalogues X, 1845 Pächt and Alexander (1973) III no. 596.
Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1425–6 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1427–8 Quarto Catalogue, cols. 1429–30 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1119 Summary Catalogue, vol. 2, part 2, p. 1125

ref.title: MLGB3: Medieval Libraries of Great Britain
